summary: This document is a summary of a call with court reporter Cindy Hopkins regarding efforts to locate a transcript and video evidence from a prior case. It details standard court reporting procedures, storage methods, and attempts to access archived materials through various systems.

persons.name: Cindy Hopkins
persons.context: She is the subject of the call, discussing her standard procedures for creating transcripts, her attempts to locate a specific transcript and video, and her use of backup systems like Carbonite.

persons.name: Toni Salopec
persons.context: Referred to as Cindy Hopkins' boss; mentioned in the context of standard procedures and that she no longer has access to the transcript in question.

connections.description: Toni Salopec is identified as the boss of court reporter Cindy Hopkins.

events.title: Call with Cindy Hopkins
events.description: A call was conducted with court reporter Cindy Hopkins to discuss locating a specific transcript and video evidence, and to understand standard transcript creation and storage procedures.

keyFacts: Standard court reporting procedure involved creating an ASCII file, using Real Legal software to create an electronic transcript with a signature and page markers, and distributing ASCII files, electronic transcripts, and hardcopies to attorneys.
Cindy Hopkins is attempting to locate a specific transcript and video; she has checked with Visual Evidence (no video) and is reviewing her external hard drive and Carbonite cloud backup.
Toni Salopec, Hopkins' boss, no longer has access to the transcript in question.
The document is subject to a protective order covering specific paragraphs (7, 8, 9, 10, 15, and 17).
